title: Jinx Problem
body:
So only recently i've been getting a pretty problematic bug where whenever i lock in Jinx the game would lock up, start opening and minimizing a few times and then closing completely without any kind of error message. Oddly enough it only seems to affect Jinx and Teemo (Who plays Teemo to even care though) and i also know as a fact it isn't Malware that's causing it since i scan my Computer every time it's turned on.
Any and all help will be appreciated; I only recently bought Jinx's Firecracker Skin and have only had 2 Games to really enjoy it.

-Doomy

replies.body:
> i also know as a fact it isn't Malware that's causing it since i scan my Computer every time it's turned on.

Well that really depends. If it was malware designed to circumvent your scanner, then of course your scanner would say everything's fine.

So, this issue, it happens with any champion you choose or just Jinx and Teemo? (It could just be that the error just *happened* to occur on those two times)

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=xnihVZrJ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-24T07:19:09.349+0000)
>
> Well that really depends. If it was malware designed to circumvent your scanner, then of course your scanner would say everything's fine.
> 
> So, this issue, it happens with any champion you choose or just Jinx and Teemo? (It could just be that the error just *happened* to occur on those two times)

It happens with only Jinx and Teemo. And it's been happening since i updated to 5.3.

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=xnihVZrJ,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-25T00:49:07.432+0000)
>
> Have you tried repairing/reinstalling?

Yep, Even attempting the repair function didn't bring back any positive results.

Reinstalling didn't fix it? Are you 100% sure of that? The reason I ask is because this issue sounds eerily close to a corrupt/wrong file being in your folders somewhere. But, of course, there could be reasons for you not reinstalling and thus we I'll attempt to find a solution without doing that.

Have you defragged your computer since they updated the sound engine (around time the new Summoner's Rift was introduced)?

Also, could you screenshot a diagnosis of your graphics card? On Windows, you can do this by running dxdiag (Ctrl+R, then type "dxdiag" and hit Enter), and then click on the "Display" tab. Screen-cap that and put it as an attachment.

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=xnihVZrJ,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-25T06:21:23.586+0000)
>
> Reinstalling didn't fix it? Are you 100% sure of that? The reason I ask is because this issue sounds eerily close to a corrupt/wrong file being in your folders somewhere. But, of course, there could be reasons for you not reinstalling and thus we I'll attempt to find a solution without doing that.
> 
> Have you defragged your computer since they updated the sound engine (around time the new Summoner's Rift was introduced)?
> 
> Also, could you screenshot a diagnosis of your graphics card? On Windows, you can do this by running dxdiag (Ctrl+R, then type "dxdiag" and hit Enter), and then click on the "Display" tab. Screen-cap that and put it as an attachment.

Yes, I have tried Defragging, Although defragging on this computer takes a stupidly long amount of time it eventually completed. Still gives me the problem though. :(

The main thing I noticed about that screen-cap is that your graphics driver is looking kinda **four years old**. Could you check to see if they've updated it? I understand that it *is* Intel, though, and if you struggle to find an update, you're probably better off not looking for one.
